conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B, analyze the process shown in the p-V diagram.
The process from state A to state B is a horizontal line on the p-V diagram, indicating constant pressure while volume changes.
Work done by the gas during a constant pressure process can be calculated using W = p ΔV.
From state A to state B, the pressure p is constant at 1 × 10^5 Pa.
The initial volume V_A is 3 L and the final volume V_B is 4 L.
The change in volume ΔV is 1 L.
Calculate the work done: W = p ΔV = (1 × 10^5 Pa) × (1 L).
Since 1 L = 0.001 m³, convert the volume to cubic meters.
The work done by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
